title: Big banks couldn't beat Monzo – so they are building their own instead
text:
Graduates starting their new jobs at the Bank of England last month were asked to raise their hands if they used Monzo. Half of them had one of the app’s coral-coloured card in their wallet.

The Bank, one of the world’s oldest financial institutions, wanted its next cohort of regulators to realise that the financial industry is changing fast and everyone needs to take notice.

This is despite the insurgents struggling to turn a profit. “Bankers who are sitting there thinking: ‘Oh well, they’re never going to make any money’ are missing the point,” says one veteran banking boss. “I don’t worry about [start-ups] making any money, they don’t have to for them to be a problem to me.”
